creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Corinthian column with heavy leaf ornamentation and scrolling motif at top; cluster of grapes in column's upper center; inscriptions on sides
marks:
Signature, Date, Inscriptions, Marks

inscribed  monogram in plate, upper right: [HSB]
date in pla
provenance: Städel Museum, Städelsches Kunstinstitut and Städtische Galerie, sale in 1800s; Heinrich Stiebel (1881-1928), sale 1920; Friedrich Quiring (born 1886, Gelsenkirchen); John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Corinthian Column
